intro: Poa stepposa var. sublaevis, commonly known as the steppe bluegrass, is a perennial grass species native to the temperate regions of Eurasia. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands, meadows, and rocky slopes. The plant has slender,丛生 (tufted) growth habit with narrow, blue-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a compact spikelet cluster, characteristic of the Poaceae family. This variety is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in stabilizing soil in marginal environments.
